sentence.Network_en: Leibniz was isolated and he railed against the teachings of the universities.
sentence.Network_cn: Leibniz是孤立的,他责骂大学的教育.

sentence.Network_en: This very slowly converging series was known to Leibniz in 1674.
sentence.Network_cn: 这个收敛很慢的级数是莱布尼茨在1674年得到的.

sentence.Network_en: Isaac Newton had a bitter feud with Leibniz.
sentence.Network_cn: 牛顿就曾与莱布尼兹成为冤家.

莱布尼茨（LEIBNIZ）认为宇宙和人的身体都是由一个个的单子组成。每一个单子都是不同的，也是不可分割的单位。

means.word_mean: 1. German philosopher and mathematician who thought of the universe as consisting of independent monads and who devised a system of the calculus independent of Newton (1646-1716)
